The spookiest of all episodes. This episode is the closure to Half-Life 2 and it leaves you with an interesting twist. Still waiting on Half-Life 3, Valve.

Yet again Valve does not disappoint. I started the game and was not happy that I did not get to use the Gravity Gun as much as I did in HL2 and Episode One. But Towards the end, I was not disappointed. I loved how in this Episode there was no "Final Boss" but a whole event, which allowed me to use my brain more, as well as use time managment techniques. If you have not played this episode I highly recommend you to do so.

Just... yes.
The defense of White Forest from striders & hunters has been byfar one of the most challenging levels of a video game I have ever played, and I was up to the challenge.

Perfection. What is there to say. 10/10

My review for HL2 Ep2 is going to be pretty similar to mine of Ep1. It's a lot more fun and interesting to play than the base game. There's more interesting story in Ep2 than the others, less downtime, and provides new unique enemies/mechanics. After playing HL2 I didn't see why anyone cared about this series whatsoever. After playing Ep1 I was beginning to understand; and after Ep2 it was definitely building up further. I still think the series is over-hyped but it's definitely good. Overall I'd give Ep2 a 7/10.

The short version: Valve make half life 3
The long version: I was always interested in the half life 3 confirmed meme. Wondering why did people want a third game? so i decided to check for myself. I bought both half life games and episodes in the valve complete pack. I started with the first game. I was not disapointed. The story was very good and altough some elements were a little annoying, i completed the game. The came time for the second one. Oh boy where do i begin. I was left amazed when i completed the game. All of the levels were amazing. The enemies challenging and the story great. Wanting more i jumped on the episodes. The i completed the second one i felt... Empty. The resistance shut down the megaportal, Eli was killed, and then what? I was left there wondering. Did Alyx and Gordon destroy the Borealis? What happened to the rest of the characters? Did the combine leave earth? So many question, so little answers. The i read the epistle 3. A blog post posted by Marc Laidlaw, writer for the half life series. And i felt.. weird like. This is a great story line, why didn't they make a third game or third episode? The anwser: CS:GO. Valve makes immence profits from CS:GO's skin, and that is why they didn't make and likely will not make a third game. Why bother? you can just make the community make content for your own game and get rich off the back of it. But with Valve's recent map to cs:go Scirocco. There are weird sounds in the underground area, that many fans say sound like striders. Could this be a hint to a third half life game? Maybe, mayne not who knows? i hope though that they will make a third half life game. Although because the storyline has been posted, i don't expect much. But if someone who has connact with valve. Even with one employee, let them know. The fans are waiting. The hopes are high and the borealis awaits. Please do not let the half life franchise end on a mere cliffhanger. Please everyone is begging you.

EPISODE THREE!!! PLEASE I BEG OF YOU VALVE!!!

This game actually makes me emotional thinking about it. Half Life is such a staple series in the gaming community, everyone has heard of this game. Half life has innovated in gameplay, graphics, and story. Unfortunately, Half-Life 2: Episode Two has ended on a cliffhanger, just waiting to be concluded in a third sequel. But due to names being taken, and companies splitting up, we can cease to hope to ever see what happens. The last we would have experienced is Gordon Freeman sitting as Alyx tries to process the death of her father, and as the screen begins to fade to black, we hear what we can conclude as her last words, "Don't leave me". That's exactly what we were in, we are Alyx Vance hanging on to her father, Half-Life, hoping it doesn't leave us, despite us knowing what will happen. I highly recommend playing the series, experiencing the superb gameplay, the breathtaking scenery, the amazing story. All I hope is that you expect what's going to happen in the end, because it will end for you like the rest of us, without a conclusion.

It's a great game! The graphics are REALLY GOOD. I do hope that Valve makes a final Half-Life game. But I honestly can't blame them if they do not. They probably make way more money selling other companies games than their own, and do not have to work as much as a game developer either. Gabe Newell probably sits at his desk, eating, while watching the money roll in. That's way easier than making a game. I mean; LOOK AT HIM. That really is probably why Half-Life's story was only a Half-Story. He ate the other half.

Objectively the worst Half Life Game. I'm serious, there is a list a mile long of all the shit wrong with the shittiest dlc of the shittiest game in the half life series. I'm serious. Fuck this game, fuck Valve, fuck Gabe Newell's stretched Asshole, and fuck You.

[spoiler] I mean, what the fuck? Not a single appearance from the supreme husbando himself, Barney Calhoun? Every Half Life game has had him to some extent save for this one. Half Life was his first appearance as a major side character. Opposing Force had him and his best bro Otis assist the player. Blue Shift put in him in the spotlight where he truly deserved to be (Making it the best Half Life Game). Half Life Decay showed his progressive side as he assisted the two female leads. Half Life 2 made him the canonical best buddy to Gordon Freeman. Half Life Ep 1 showed off his heroic humane side. But no fucking Barney in Episode 2? What the fuck Valve? I just hope that as this shitshow of a game unfolded for me, the Spirit of Calhoun followed me throughout. [spoiler]

Can't believe it's been over 11 years since Half Life 2: Episode Two came out. Also cannot believe Gaben has the audacity to let millions of fans hanging even although Valve is swimming in more money than Scrooge McDuck.

That aside, Episode Two to this day remains one of the most fun story heavy FPS experiences and it doesn't even look half bad for such an old title. It's not Crysis, but it is more than sufficient to be played.
